question: In the reaction between hydrogen sulphide and acidified permanganate solution,
choices: <katex>$H_{2}S$</katex> is reduced to S, <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex>
<katex>$H_{2}S$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$SO_{2}$</katex>, <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$MnO_{2}$</katex>
<katex>$H_{2}S$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$SO_{2}$</katex>, <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex>
<katex>$H_{2}S$</katex> is oxidised to S, <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex>
explanation: The reaction is: <katex>$H_{2}S + MnO_{4}^{-} + H^{+} \rightarrow S + Mn^{2+} + H_{2}O$</katex>
